Let k be an integral domain and G an arbitrary finite set.
Then any algebra morphism φ : (G → k) →ₐ[k] k is an evaluation map.

I need this lemma for Tannaka duality for finite groups (#22176) but it doesn't really fit with the rest.
I made the PR #23065 for this lemma but I still don't know where it should go.
I also have the PR #23066 that is independent and ready for review.
